bibl.title: Letter from John R. Kissinger to Howard A. Kelly, March 20, 1907

div1.p: Kissinger writes about his improved finances, his ill health, and his gratitude for the many contributions.

div1.head: Letter from John R. Kissinger to Howard A. Kelly, March 20, 1907

opener.dateline:
March 20/ 1907 Dr Kelly
1418 Eutaw Pl,
Md

div1.p:
Your letter received
some few days ago and all so
the beautiful book, whitch
I appreciate very highly words
could not express my thanks

I have neglected writing
this season as you mentioned
my picture at the tub help-
-ing my wife. Dr Kelly Mr.
Kissinger being so Nervious he
Insists on my finishing this
letter. he has been rather slow
to respond but we were short
2
of money It hinched us but
we found a Gentleman with a
camera he called at the House
took one in wheel chair one at
the tub after Seeing Mr. Kissinger
condition he only charged him $1.00
Mr. Kissinger I sent as well as
he was for a while and the Dr.
has forbidden him to do a thing
he has helped all that was in
his Power to do but It been but
little the Dr Said he was loosing
in Vitality. but our circumstances
madke. It nessary for us to work.
and he is so Nervious he will
not sit by and watch me work.
without trying to help. his Dr.
Is E. K Dean and Is doing all he
can for Mr. Kissinger. I will enclose
3
one of the Dr Cards- the Photo
was returned to us we received
It today but did not get your
Photo, but would be very glad
to get one; Mr. Kissinger thinks
lots of the Book you sent and
says you have done splendid in
getting the Details as well as you
have of Dr. Major Reeds experiment
for yellow fever: and expresses
his Sorrow that Major Reed had
to give up his life just when he
should Reaped the Reward, from his
Great Work: he had done.-
Mr. Kissinger has been somewhat
disapoited, he was in hope to
get some Pension that he could
go away to Hot Springs or some
4
Place for a change of climate
thinking that might Improve his
health Congressman Brick. took
the matter up through Mr. Kissinger
friends here and Put bill in
Congress for $.50 but It dropped to
$12. the last we heard of it and
was yet to have the Presidents Sig-
nature so we have heard nothing
further from It Mr. Kissinger
has been very backward about applying
for a Pension as he had offerd
himself for the experiment and felt
as though. People would think he
wanted to Reap a benefit from
It. he would like to have John
J. Moran's Address: if you have
It I do washings for others and
5
Its a very hard way and a slow
way but an Honest way of making
money my Hands are so stiff from
having them in water so much
you must excuse this writing

Wishing to hear from you
when convenient and thanking
you for the Interest you have
shown will bid you Goodnight
div1.closer:
yours Respectfully John R Kissinger South Bend
606 E Keasey St. Ind
P.S. I will send Photos by the
same mail
